CDFglobalAttributes.Data_type: DP24 > Data Product 2.4: FUV Limb Daytime
CDFglobalAttributes.Generated_by: ICON FUV L1 > ICON FUV L2 Limb v05r000, R. Meier
CDFglobalAttributes.History: Version 001, First public release, limb data only. S. L. England Version 001, First release version that uses the limb radiances to compute O/N2, and altitude profiles of O, N2 and similar. S. L. England, R. R. Meier
CDFglobalAttributes.MODS: Version 001, First public release, limb data only. S. L. England Version 001, First release version that uses the limb radiances to compute O/N2, and altitude profiles of O, N2 and similar. S. L. England, R. R. Meier
CDFglobalAttributes.TEXT: ICON explores the boundary between Earth and space (the ionosphere) to understand  the physical connection between our world and the immediate space environment around us. Visit http://icon.ssl.berkeley.edu  for more details.
CDFglobalAttributes.Text_Supplement: This describes the data product for ICON FUV Limb Daytime O/N2 (DP 2.4),  which is in NetCDF4 format. The ratio of oxygen to nitrogen in the thermosphere is obtained from the two channels of ICON FUV instrument data in, through an inversion process described in https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-018-0477-6. NOTE: In this file, only the limb parameters are included. These files are named ICON_L2-4_FUV_Day_Limb_YYYY-MM-DD_vXXrZZZ.NC, where YYYY-MM-DD is the year month day and vXX shows the version number  and ZZZ shows the revision number of this file.  Each individual file nominally contains 1 day (24 hours) of data. The L2 FUV Limb Daytime  files are produced from the L1 FUV files. In addition, many other parameters and geophysical data products are included in the file.  All variables within the file are described in their Var_notes attribute. The data are identified in one of 3 var_types: data – which  contains the primary data product; support data – which contains parameters used in the retrieval such as geometry etc. that may also  be useful in any analysis of this data; and ignore_data – which are recorded for debugging purposes and should not be used for publication  without detailed discussion with the ICON team.  The dimensions of the data also indicate its type.  For example, anything with epoch as a dimension means there is 1 value corresponding  to each instrument exposure. Anything with dimension Input_data corresponds to the input data, passed from Level 1.   Anything with dimension altitude corresponds to the altitude grid used for the inverted parameters.
CDFglobalAttributes.TITLE: ICON FUV Daytime Limb
CDFglobalAttributes.NCO: netCDF Operators version 4.8.1 (Homepage = http://nco.sf.net, Code = http://github.com/nco/nco)
CDFglobalAttributes.NC_DIMENSIONS_G:
Epoch=UNLIMITED
Limb Altitude Grid=22
Input Data=50
Limb Retrieval Flag=3

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Time_Base Time_Scale Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Time corresponding to the center of each observation, in milliseconds since Jan 1 1970.
Computed CDF_Epoch value: time_base+Epoch added by SPDF
EPOCH of 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00 - added by SPDF

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Altitude grid used by the retrieval, in WGS, as a function of time.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Value of Ap used in the forward model, as a function of time. These data are from http://www-app3.gfz-potsdam.de/kp_index/. These are the tabulated Kp values from GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences at the Helmholtz Centre Potsdam.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Retrieved column O/N2 from the limb data, as a function of time.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Unscaled value of F10.7 used as an input to the inversion process, as a function of time. These data are from ftp://ftp.seismo.nrcan.gc.ca/spaceweather/solar_flux/fluxtable.txt. These are the solar radio flux values tabulated from the Space Weather Canada which is a part of Natural Resources Canada.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Tangent altitudes of input data, in km above the WGS-84 geoid, as functions of time
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Tangent altitudes of input data, in km above the WGS-84 geoid, as functions of time
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* Tangent altitudes of input data, in km above the WGS-84 geoid, as functions of time.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Corrected input data for the LW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Corrected input data for the LW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* Corrected L1 LW brigthnesses after applying inverse transform to remove scattered ligth. Values for the LW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Corrected input data for the SW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Corrected input data for the SW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* Corrected L1 SW brigthnesses after applying inverse transform to remove scattered ligth. Values for the SW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Line of sight azimuth angles, in degrees, as functions tangent altitdue of time

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Line of sight zenith angles, in degrees, as functions tangent altitdue of time

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* Line of sight zenith angles, in degrees, as functions tangent altitdue of time

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Uncorrected input data for the LW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Uncorrected input data for the LW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* Uncorrected L1 LW brigthnesses before applying inverse transform to remove scattered ligth. Values for the LW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Uncorrected input data for the SW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Uncorrected input data for the SW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* Original L1 SW brigthnesses before applying inverse transform to remove scattered ligth. Values for the SW channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: TYPE CATDESC CONTENT DEPEND_0 DISPLAY_TYPE FIELDNAM FORMAT LABLAXIS UNITS VAR_TYPE SCALETYP VAR_NOTES
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Data collection mode of FUV instrument         1 = Dayside science         2 = Nightside science         3 = Calibration         4 = Nadir         5 = Conjugate         6 = Stars         7 = Ram         8 = Off Target         9 = Engineering        13 = Unknown

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* Number of iteration steps performed before model converged on answer, as a function of time.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Latitude of the retrieval, defined at 150 km tangent altitude, in WGS

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Quality indicator (also quickly shows         times when images are available)
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: TYPE CATDESC CONTENT DEPEND_0 DISPLAY_TYPE FIELDNAM FORMAT LABLAXIS UNITS VAR_TYPE SCALETYP VAR_NOTES
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: QUALITY_FLAG is an indicator of data quality =          0 = No errors or quality conditions, LVLH          1 = No errors or quality conditions, R-LVLH          2 = Lunar calibration          3 = Insufficient high voltage          4 = Nadir calibration          5 = Zero wind calibration          6 = Bad pointing          7 = S/C attitude slew          8 = Conjugate observation          9 = Stellar calibration         10 = Unreliable background subtracted         17 = unspecified error condition

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Limb retrieval quality flag, where 0 = no limb inversion, 1 = retrieval nominal, 2 = number of iterations in retrieval algorithm reaches 10 without convergence, 3 = one or more inversion model parameters hits a priori upper or lower limit, 4 = altitude of peak intensity too close to boundary, 5 = standard deviation of one or more variables exceeds expected limit, 6 = Chi-squared value is outside of expected range - either too large or too small, 7 = one or more uncertainties is outside of expected range.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Local solar time of the retrieval, defined at 150 km tangent altitude, in WGS

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Longitude of the retrieval, defined at 150 km tangent altitude, in WGS

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* flag = 0 - nominal, flag(0)= 1 - 20 steps reached without convergining, flag(1)=1 model para hit upper or lower limit, flag(2)=1 peak alt is too close to boundary

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Retrieved altitude profile of N2 from the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Retrieved altitude profile of O from the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Retrieved altitude profile of O2 from the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: *Diagnostic* Effective solar EUV energy flux, mW/m2

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Retrieved altitude grid sigma molecular N2
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Retrieved altitude grid sigma molecular N2
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved N2 from the retrieval, as a function of altitude and time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Retrieved altitude grid sigma atomic O
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Retrieved altitude grid sigma atomic O
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved O from the retrieval, as a function of altitude and time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Retrieved altitude grid sigma molecular O2
VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Retrieved altitude grid sigma molecular O2
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved O2 from the retrieval, as a function of altitude and time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved O/N2 from the retrieval, as a function of time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved temperature from the retrieval, as a function of altitude and time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Solar zenith angle of the retrieval, defined at 150 km tangent altitude, in WGS

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Depend_1 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Retrieved altitude profile of temperature from the retrieval, in K, as a function of altitude and time.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Date and Time in UTC format
VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam FillVal Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: UTC time corresponding to the retrieved parameters, in string format, as a function of time, in the format: 2017-05-27/00:00:01.435

VarAttributes.NC_STRINGS_V: CatDesc Depend_0 Display_Type FieldNam Long_Name Units Var_Notes Var_Type
VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Single flag set for whole day, where 0 = nominal data set, 1 = whole day skipped because no solar zenith angles were within range.
